name: Bill Wagner
text: A beautiful facility in an outstanding place on the beach.

name: Jerry Duke
text: Great area

name: Brently Goodin
text: Quiet. Ok if you dont wanna be on the beach.

name: Brandy Hand
text: They are great

name: Sharnell White
text: The staff at Advenir is absolutely exceptional! They are friendly and always so prompt and eager to help with any and every situation- maintenance request, relative information updates, etc. Shekinah is a gem and I am so glad to have come in contact with her. Imani and Grace are fantastic as well. The team makes up a great dynamic and I highly recommend this complex!

resp.text:
Thank you for your wonderful review!
We love hearing about our awesome staff, as they work extremely hard to provide a great experience for our current and future residents.
If you would like to leave more feedback, we would be delighted to hear from you. Email us at station121@advenirliving.com.
Thank you!
The Advenir at Station 121

name: Erica Moore
text:
The staff was very nice and professional!
Shakinah was able to provide me with all my needs! I highly recommend Advenir at Station 121to live!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your review, Erica.  We are happy to hear that Shakinah was able to help you with all your needs and that you recommend our community.  Here, at Advenir at Station 121, we strive daily to earn ratings such as this by providing our residents with superior customer service and a quality living experience. Thank you, again, for your review.

Kindest regards,
Advenir at Station 121
Management Team

name: Skylar Warmund
text:
I can’t say enough about how great Jacob, the property manager, is. I lived here until October 2020 with old management, and while the apartment was great, I unfortunately had to move out due to a job offer in another state. Old management was less than stellar, leaving Jacob and his team with a lot of cleaning up to do; but they were up for the challenge.

I had a very stressful situation related to my move out and Jacob was so calm, understanding, helpful, and took care of things quickly. Jacob took extra time to review my concerns (which were present prior to him taking over as manager) and familiarize himself with my situation.  My only complaint is that they got such a great management team once I moved! This is how property management companies should be run. Thank you Jacob!!

From an apartment standpoint, the apartments are in a perfect location-very quick walk to uab campus and the hospital. The amenities are beautiful, and we specifically loved the dog park on the roof! If I didn’t have to move for work, I’d still be happily living there. Can’t go wrong with this apartment and this management team!

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback, Skylar. We are glad to hear you have had a great experience with our community and office team. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to improve.
The Advenir at Station 121 Management Team

name: Jessica V
text: Perfectly located for work downtown, as well as easy access to major highways for a quick trip around the city. Walking distance to good restaurants, and to Publix for groceries. The staff is incredibly helpful and attentive.

resp.text: Jessica V.,  thank you for taking time to give your review. We are so glad to hear that you love the location of our community. We pride ourselves on uphold a high level of customer satisfaction. Advenir at Station 121Management Team.

name: Ethan Howard
text: Couldn’t recommend this property more. Great location and close to all of the fun south side spots. Work downtown and walked to work everyday. Leasing office is great, very attentive and responded to repair requests quickly.

resp.text:
Thank you for leaving us a 5-star review Ethan! We are glad you are enjoying our community here at Advenir at Station 121. We pride ourselves on our great location and wonderful staff, and we are happy to hear you are loving them as well. If you have any other feedback, please contact us at 205-320-5277.
-Advenir at Station 121 Management Team

name: Natalia Sztukowski
text: Love the new staff! They are attentive to your concerns and make you feel like a priority. Overall, very happy with my experience here.

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback, Natalia. We are happy to hear you have had a great experience with our office staff. We strive to provide the best customer service possible for our residents. Please let us know if we an improve in any way.
The Advenir at Station 121 Management Team

name: Luke Thomas
text: Awesome location. I love the walkability and having the Rotary Trail next door. It's great for running and walking my dog. Staff is great too!

resp.text:
Thank you for taking time to post this review. We are so pleased to offer you a 5-star living experience. We value your feedback.

Sincerely,
Advenir at Station 121

name: Setu Patel
text:
Lived here for 3 years and now leaving the state so had to move out. Cannot recommend this building enough. I’ve never had any issues.
Management is very responsive, maintenance requests are handled within 24 hours, walls are thick enough that I don’t ever hear my neighbors.
Package lockers, controlled access garage, great pool and gym, what else can you ask for. Def worth checking out.

resp.text:
Thank you for taking time to post this review. We are so pleased to bring you a 5-star experience and greatly appreciate your feedback.

Warmest Regards,
Advenir at Station 121

name: Sam Anabtawi
text: Been here for almost 2 years and love it so far. Common spaces are always clean and well maintained. Maintenance is very responsive and I love that you can submit a service request online instead of having to call someone. The leasing office are great to deal with and do a good job of handling delivery packages. And the best part is that it's incredibly quiet! Having stayed in multiple rentals around Birmingham and Atlanta, this is one of the quietest building I've ever lived in. I can never hear my neighbors or people in the hallway and even with an apartment facing the street, with the exception of the occasional siren, I can't hear any traffic.

resp.text:
Hello Sam,
What a nice and very thoughtful review. We appreciate so much your honest feedback and recommendations about our community. We hope you continue to enjoy our community, and please don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or concerns. Have a wonderful day! Your Advenir at Station 121 Team.

name: Alex W
text: Cheapest (for now) apartments downtown, and sadly you get what you pay for. Noise complaints get ignored, on-call maintenance staff "can't be reached" when emergencies arise, and gym equipment either stays broken or gets flat-out stolen. The office staff is terrible at communicating with residents...unless of course they're asking for money. Rent prices have gone up and quality has gone down since Advenir took over and fired everyone with experience, so I cannot recommend this or any of their other properties to anyone. Looking forward to moving out!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Alex. We apologize about the issues you have been having with us at Advenir at Station 121. We strive to make sure our residents are happy while living in our community and that they get the best customer service possible from our staff. I can understand how rental increases can be challenging and we strive to always keep our apartment prices comparable to the market while offering similar amenities and services. Please reach out to us or stop by the office and we will discuss your review further and work towards a resolution. Have a great day and we hope to hear from you soon, the Advenir at Station 121 team.

name: Ethan Howard
text: Couldn’t recommend this property more. Great location and close to all of the fun south side spots. Work downtown and walked to work everyday. Leasing office is great, very attentive and responded to repair requests quickly.

resp.text:
Thank you for leaving us a 5-star review Ethan! We are glad you are enjoying our community here at Advenir at Station 121. We pride ourselves on our great location and wonderful staff, and we are happy to hear you are loving them as well. If you have any other feedback, please contact us at 205-320-5277.
-Advenir at Station 121 Management Team

name: Evan Hudson
text:
My wife and I picked Advenir for the "downtown experience" after we got married, and we absolutely love it.  Living downtown is expensive, sure, but their prices are significantly less than any of the other luxury apartments on the block.  And this place is well worth it!  Pros include: a secure parking deck,  walking distance to Publix,  UAB (campus and health system),  bars and restaurants,  Region's Field,  Railroad Park,  and tons of other stuff too.  You can work out at Orange Theory, grab a pizza and pint from Pies and Pints, and then walk upstairs without going more than a block.  UAB Urgent Care right below the apartment is a huge plus too.

We (luckily) haven't had to call maintenance too much, but they have been prompt during each visit. Usually by the end of the day.  Office staff has always been friendly and helpful.  You can get as much free coffee from the office as you want too. (Big plus for me)  Our unit is the perfect size for a new married couple downtown.  Floors look nice, kitchen is updated, and the unit is well insulated. (Not a lot of A/C cost)

We've gotten to where we really only drive on the weekend, if that.  Advenir is a great spot to live downtown, and with all the other apartments coming up we feel like we made the right choice.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you are having a great experience and enjoying your home. Warmest regards. The Advenir at Station 121 Management Team.

name: Marie Welch
text: We lived at Station 121 for 3 years and loved our time here! It is a GREAT location - located between UAB medical campus and downtown Birmingham. There have been a lot of new apartment buildings come available within the last couple of years, but I still feel like Station 121 has the best location. The leasing/management staff is fabulous! Always so friendly and helpful. Even though this building is not the newest compared to some others in the area, the management keep the building looking new and apartments are modern and clean. Really great place to live for young professionals.

resp.text:
Hi Marie,
Thank you so much for taking the time of posting a review even after moving out. We are sad to see you leave, but we hope this new chapter in your is full of great things. Please know that if you ever need our help, we are here for you and all of our residents. We are glad we were able to provide with an amazing experience while you lived here. We hope you have an awesome day! Your Advenir at Station 121 Team (:

name: Gaurav Goyal
text: Very horrible customer service. My ac stopped working over the weekend. When I called the customer service at night (Jasmine), she told me they can only fix my AC as an “emergency” if the temperature is above 80 degrees. I ended up staying at another place. Called them next day when the temperature was 90 degrees and was told that it will be fixed. Drove back to check but it was not fixed. Opened another ticket with them. Called them after 2 hours, spoke to the same agent (Jasmine) to tell me if the issue has been fixed. I was told she cannot check on that for me and I could drive back to my place and check myself. Super unprofessional and unhelpful. The property itself is nice but spending a hot summer day without AC just because you are following “protocol” is purely negligent!

resp.text: Hi Gaurav, we're so sorry to hear about the issues you've experienced with your AC. We completely understand how frustrating that can be, and we want you to be comfortable in your home. Our team would like to chat with you directly about this and your other concerns, so will you please email us at station121mgr@advenirliving.com at your earliest convenience? We appreciate the opportunity to improve your satisfaction. Sincerely, Advenir at Station 121.

name: Alicia D
text: If you are looking for a wonderful place to live in a thriving and well located urban area, LIVE HERE. You can walk to places like Children’s Hospital, UAB, AT&T ,Banks, Starbucks, The Atomic Lounge, The Collins, Paramount, Railroad Park, Regions Field, breweries, restaurants, shopping, and so many other great places Birmingham has to offer. I LOVE Advenir at Station 121 and I am only leaving because I will be relocating to another state. Some of these reviews are laughable. You can't judge an apartment community on surrounding construction. That's not their fault. You can't blame an apartment if your dog ruins the carpet and you exit before your lease is over and you have to pay to replace the carpet. You also can’t judge an apartment community because of some bad reviews. I moved to Birmingham from California and it was my first time living in a downtown/urban type of environment, and it was absolutely fantastic. The pool was always clean, the grounds were well taken care of, the 3 amazingly wonderful ladies in the office became my family ( Tara,Mandy and Ellen). They always took the time to get to know me and what was going on in my life, and they genuinely love me. Leaving them will be very hard because it was such a great place.I never had any trouble with break-ins (which will happen in ANY downtown area if you don't park behind the security gate!).As for others saying that it was noisy, when you live in an apartment you can't expect it to be silent all the time, but I can say that I  never had any trouble with an overabundance of noise at all. 90% of anything I ever heard was normal city noise, but if you want to live in a silent environment, buy a house in the woods. Overall, Advenir at Station 121 is a phenomenal place to live. Nothing is ever perfect, but they were completely fair at all times. Swing by and talk to the ladies in the office, you won't regret it. These 2 years have been a wonderful experience!!

resp.text:
Hi Alicia,
Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review. We are sad to see you go, but we are very happy for you. We wish you the best on this new adventure of yours. We truly appreciate your kind words about our community and our staff. Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. We always strive to provide top quality service to every prospect and resident, and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your experience here. Thank you again for taking the time to let the world know about your positive experience. Have a great day! The Advenir at Station 121 Team.

name: Joanne Lin
text:
Live here, you won't regret it!

4 years ago, we leased our apartment when we were still in California, sight unseen and have been so happy with our decision. The apartment is lovely and spacious, the facilities are really nice - the fitness room, outdoor area with grills, the pool...the only thing we've not used is the dog park but it looks fun! Our maintenance requests (though few and far between because everything works well!) have always been dealt with efficiently, and we've never had an issue with safety.

It's always been a great location - walking distance to restaurants downtown, Railroad Park, Regions Field, UAB etc. but the surrounding area has only got better over the years. More dining options, the Rotary Trail, bike shares, Publix.

While it's a great apartment complex, it's the ladies in the office who make this place what it is - a warm, friendly community that we call home. Every time you pop in, they ask about your day, they want to hear about the things going on in your life, and they always ALWAYS go above and beyond to help. They have been like a second family to us and I cannot say enough wonderful things about them.

resp.text:
Hi Joanne,
We're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! Your wonderful feedback and rating mean a lot to us. Thank you again for taking the time of sharing your experience with us. We are happy to know that you enjoy our community amenities and our location. We hope you continue to enjoy your stay with us. Have a magnificent day! The Advenir at Station 121 Team.

name: Matthew McCarley
text: I have lived here for six months, and so far I am very pleased with the property, location, and staff. The grounds are generally well-kept and very secure. An HID key fob is required for entrance into any exterior door to the building. I have had zero issue with noise in the property. I have not witnessed any crime of any kind within the property. I live on the 4th floor of the west side of the building facing 20th street, and street noise is a problem - mostly it's just the sirens from ambulances headed to the hospital. This, of course, is nothing the property or staff have any control over, just a note for those considering living here and choosing a unit. Garage parking is plentiful though not assigned, and if you get home after 6pm or so you may not get to park on your floor, which isn't a big deal as there are multiple stairwells and elevators around. The property just installed a locker system to handle package deliveries that you can access with a code 24/7, which is convenient. Also trash chutes on each floor are nice. Front desk staff are all very friendly and know your name. What I've been most impressed with so far is the maintenance staff. I have put in four or five requests for maintenance to my unit, and they all were handled the next business day. The on-site gym, common room, and pool seem nice, but I have not spent any time in them. Location is fantastic if you want walking distance to some places to eat or bars, etc. Rent seems a bit high but I suppose it is comparable (perhaps even less) to similar properties nearby.

resp.text: Hi Mathew,  Thank you so much for taking the time of sharing your review. We are very happy to know that you are enjoying the community and loving the location. Your feedback is greatly appreciated it. If you need our assistance again in the future, be sure to reach out to us any time. Have a wonderful day! Your Advenir at Station 121 Team.

name: Luigi Mendez
text: The staff here are completely unhelpful and unpleasant once you become a resident. Also, more importantly, cars have been stolen and broken into. To me, as an enterprise employee, I value the process that goes into having to go weeks without your car and pay additional money for new insurance on a rental car while your personal vehicle is stolen due to station 121, and their lack of concern for investing in security.

resp.text: Hi Luigi, thank you for providing us with the details of your living experience here at Advenir at Station 121. We are sorry to hear that you have had some inconsistencies with our management team and we would like to speak to you more about some of the concerns you have had over the past months. If you would like to schedule a meeting with the Community Manager please contact us at (205) 320-5277. Sincerely, The Advenir at Station 121 Management Team.

name: Dhaval Shah
text: Do not bother coming here. When you walk in to tour the property they say you need an appointment and when you make an appointment and be on time they take walk ins and make you wait. Also do not park at future resident parking because the entrance is locked and you will stay there for a while until someone lets you in. Horrible service

resp.text: Hi Dhaval, first and foremost, thank you so much for stopping by our community. We regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 277-6335 or station121mgr@advenirliving.com. We look forward to hearing from you. Sincerely, Advenir at Station 121.

name: Olivia Melvin
text: This is an amazing place to live! It is really well maintained and it located in a great spot. Also, the staff is AMAZING! Ellen has gone above and beyond helping us. We've had some stuff come up and she has been so helpful in sorting it all out.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review! We are pleased to hear that you are satisfied here at Advenir at Station 121. We work hard to make our residents happy through great customer service. We would love to know how we can continue to improve. Please contact us at 205-321-5277.

Warmest regards,
Advenir at Station 121

name: M J
text: This place is amazing. Lived here for three years, never really had a problem. The staff is very nice and very helpful, from management to the maintenance crew. If there is an issues it was resolved very quickly, the location is perfect right in the middle of everything. I would highly recommend advenir the place to stay. Great job guys!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you are having a great experience and enjoying your home. Warmest regards. The Advenir at Station 121 Management Team.

name: Luke Thomas
text: Awesome location. I love the walkability and having the Rotary Trail next door. It's great for running and walking my dog. Staff is great too!

resp.text:
Thank you for taking time to post this review. We are so pleased to offer you a 5-star living experience. We value your feedback.

Sincerely,
Advenir at Station 121

name: Bill Matthews
text:
Looking for a safe place to live in Birmingham? Do not live here. The lack of security is abysmal. After my car was stolen, the management staff gave a response implying that there had been nothing else occurring in the garage in that realm of criminal activity. Turned out there were multiple cars with windows shattered after criminals had attempted to either commit grand theft auto or car burglary just the night before. I bumped into another resident that I knew a few days later, and turns out his brother had a car there that had a window completely shattered the weekend before my car was stolen. He reported it to the staff, but the staff failed to mention that to me. I had spoken to another resident a few months later, and they mentioned their car had been broken into as well in the garage. Fast Facts on public crime record data with the Birmingham Police crime statistics Department from 1/1/2017-5/30/2018 on the 2000 block of 2nd Avenue south:
Adult Sex Offender-ID Required-1
AUTO THEFT-3*** (They did NOT mention the three before mine, as mine came after 5/30)
Harassment- 2
Theft of Property-18
UNLAWFUL BREAKING/ENTERING INTO VEHICLE: 16

The facts say it all. Stay away from this place. Glad to have recently moved out.

resp.text: Hi Bill, thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback. It is unfortunate that your vehicle was stolen. Our goal is to present a positive, professional image at all times. We strive to deliver a consistently positive experience. Law enforcement has made us aware of several vehicle break ins in the area. We are very sorry this happened to you. We do hope that we can change your opinion of our community in the future! If you're ever in need of help, please let us know. Sincerely, the Advenir at Station 121 Team.

name: David Sellers
text: It has been absolutely incredible living here this past 7 months! Community is great, easy access for food and grocery shopping! Love the new dog park and the friendly neighbors!! I started off in a corporate apartment but decided to stay due to loving it here!

resp.text:
Hi David,
Thank you for your kind review. We hope to continue making your living experience with us a great one and you continue to enjoy our amenities. Have a wonderful day! The Advenir at Station 121 Team.

name: Maria Bertuso
text: Five years of living here and I wouldn't want to live anywhere else downtown. Perfect location, close to Publix, bars and restaurants. Plus the office staff is very helpful through all stages of moving and living here.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review. We are pleased to provide you with a 5-star living experience. We value your feedback and look forward to hearing how we can continuously improve. We invite you to contact us at 205-320-5277.

Thank you,
Advenir at Station 121

name: Matthew Broyles
text: Lived there for over 2 years! Close to everything downtown and best downtown pool!  The staff is great! They we’re always great to work with and with upmost professionalism. I would definitely recommend this place to live at.

resp.text: Matthew,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. We hope you have a great day!   The Advenir at Station 121 Team

name: David Kalani Mench
text: Great place to live with friendly staff! Any maintenance issues (though there were few) were addressed quickly. If you’re looking for a place to live downtown this is a great spot!

resp.text: (name) Thank you for your kind review. We are so glad to hear that we are meeting all of your expectations and that you are having a great experience and enjoying your home. -The Advenir at Station 121 Management Team.

name: James Miles
text: Horrible place to live ....the leasing mgr. Is horrible

name: Cait Chri
text: Love the Clubhouse. There are even showers in the men and women's locker rooms near the gym. Gym is better than the planet fitness!! Pool is fun! This place is perfect for students to live with friends.

resp.text: We love our new gym, too! Thank you so much!

name: tammy stanfield
text:
Read this before signing a lease. My daughter lived at this apartment complex for two years. When we got the house assignment before my daughter moved in they had completely changed the type house that my daughter had agreed to rent. Then they said directed me to the place in the least small print where it says they can switch you to any unit they please. There was nothing we could do about it. While we were in the unit the hot water heater was replaced going to a gas hot water heater and because the gas was in my name they charged the hot water heater to my account. It was charged to my gas account and debited out of my checking account, $1800 without my permission. I had to wait three months to be reimbursed and I also had to wait on a coupon from the gas company to be reimbursed. We could not wait to get out of there.

——I did receive a phone call a few days after posting my review from the corporate office about my negative review. I want to clarify that Spire didn’t charge my account without the On-site management people at Creekside letting the gas company into the home. I nor my daughter was there to let them in and the only people that authorized the charge and transaction was Creekside and Creekside refused to call Spire and correct the problem by billing them or the owner of the condo. Also, the small print indicating they could and did switch the unit that we wanted is a fact and an issue that future tenants need to understand. It makes you realize that they could and did show a nice unit in the style, location, and price and switch you to whatever they want.  They placed our daughter in a unit that was at the entrance to the community, high traffic, high noise, and her Eno was stolen off the tiny porch the first week.

resp.text: Hi Mrs. Stanfield! Thank you for taking our call this afternoon to discuss Spire charging your account for the water heater. We are glad they were able to sort everything out, but apologize for the lengthiness of the process.

If you are looking for a place to live Fall or Spring you have to look at Creekside or you'll miss out BIG time! Also shout out to Charlie in the front office for helping Kristen pack my WHOLE house and move it to my new unit for me while I was abroad. name: Steve Klein
text:
I lived here for three years and figured I'd let people know my thoughts. Some of it is good, some of it is bad, some of it could go either way depending on what you want out of a place to live, and some of it is just unavoidable as it is targeted to college students.

Some aspects of the property are really nice. The clubhouse is pretty nice (though the weight room is a joke; I don't know why any Auburn student would use it instead of the top notch campus facility). The common areas are generally well-maintained. I say generally because while the landscaping is kept up, the gates are not. I've been trying to get my name added to the call box for three years and it still hasn't happened, yet I know residents that moved out years ago still in the list.  The gates are frequently broken and they keep nobody out. If someone wants to get in, they will get in. They will simply wait for someone to open the gate and go in after them. If you are going to be a "gated community" then be a gated community. In my opinion, Creekside should just get rid of the gates because they really don't accomplish anything except annoy the residents.

Creekside does not tow. This could be good or bad depending on your point of view. I never had an issue with parking. On busy football weekends, perhaps I'd be 10-12 spots away from my front door but that was about the extent of it. However, other parts of the complex may not have quite as abundant parking so that could be an issue. I'm really not sure. It was nice to not have to deal with visitor passes, etc. but it would be very frustrating if there wasn't enough parking near your home.

Creekside does not enforce many of its own rules. The one that really annoys me is the pool. It is supposed to be limited to residents and residents are allowed two guests I believe. What it ends up being is tons of people who might know one person in Creekside... or in some cases just show up without knowing anyone. I pay good money to live in a place like this and don't feel like my money should be going to clean up after non-residents who break chairs, leave beer cans and bottles strewn about, etc. Some would say I'm a party pooper... but I like to think of it as being irritated by trespassing. People (many times non-residents) bring beer bottles and dogs to the pool routinely... both are supposed to be fineable offenses... but I've never seen one handed out.

Maintenance is a mixed bag, but mainly poor. To get a broken door repaired, it took about a dozen phone calls over a two month period. Simply absurd. I also reported a broken toilet two different times. Once, it was repaired promptly. The other time... I was told they'd be out there "in the next couple of days" and nobody ever came. After about a week, I fixed the toilet myself. Also, I should point out that *OWNERS* are occasionally treated as second-class citizens by the on-site management. Essentially, the homeowner's dues should get me the same rights as the renter's... but when I file a maintenance issue that is supposed to be covered by the HOA dues, they handle all renters first... I guess to make sure they get people to resign because they know the homeowner is unlikely to sell because of a small issue like this. Or, in the vast majority of cases, it isn't the actual homeowner who lives in the house; It is often the parent of one of the residents who probably never even hears about the issue.

The last issue I have is with the TV/Internet Service. It has been nothing short of awful the entire time I've lived here. In 2015, I don't think people can really appreciate just how bad I have had it and what a negative it is. The internet is slow, often less than 1 megabit/second so forget about streaming Netflix during peak hours; You'll be lucky if you can just get a YouTube video to play in 240p, nevermind HD.

All in all, it is a decent place to live. You could definitely do a lot worse. I think I'd rather pay for a location closer to campus rather than the resort style amenities, but that is personal preference.

resp.text: Thank you for the valuable information

name: Angie Chatham Denton
text: Real nice, gated community.!

resp.text: Thank you Angie!

name: Kelly Tsaltas
text:
Creekside of Auburn claims to have the best pool and amenities in Auburn and to be “student living redefined.” Their definition of student living, however, did not live up to its advertisement.

Firstly, what they boast as the best pool in Auburn is ever crawling with non-residents and is usually dirty. Oftentimes people who come to the pool don’t even know anyone in the complex (I have no idea how they get in). Adding to their being unwelcome is the fact that they, along with actual residents, throw empty beer cans and cigarettes into the pool, making it disgusting and completely unable to be used.

Creekside also advertises itself as a gated community. Unlike other gated complexes, however, Creekside uses a barcode scan system, which is usually broken. Thus the gates are open 24 hours a day, including weekends. If the gates are closed and the scanner is broken, there is no code to open the gates, which led to three broken gates because of cars driving through them in the year that I lived there. Why they chose a system with no backup way to get in is beyond me.

Creekside is a magnet for irresponsible students who love to party loudly. I did not understand how there could be such a high concentration of people with such habits, but then I discovered that much of Creekside’s advertising involves half of drink specials for residents and other alcoholic incitements. There were obnoxiously loud parties that could be heard two rows of houses over and up the street nearly every weekend and even on weekdays. These parties were rampant with underage drinking and lasted until four a.m. or later. The courtesy officer never picks up his phone, so the police usually come. This is an inconvenience and an annoyance for the officers, especially since Creekside hired someone who is supposedly responsible for taking care of such noise disturbances.

The Internet is abysmal, and it is nearly impossible to get someone to come out and fix it. Our Internet didn’t work for three months, and the management refused to give us a refund on the portion of our rent that went toward cable and Internet.  They also refused to let us get our own router.

Management threatens to fine its residents constantly, but never follows up; therefore, what looks like a beautiful complex from outside the gates is full of porches that are littered with beer cans, cigarettes, trash, and beer pong tables. Any complaints about the state of the porches will go unnoticed.

All in all, Creekside is a place for rich kids whose parents don’t care if they drink excessively underage and blow off classes in the morning due to a midweek party. Were I a parent, no matter how much money I had, I would avoid investing in a unit in Creekside like the plague.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback on our college student community.

name: Kevin
text: Expensive. Internet service provider is horrible. Most nights around 10pm the internet either goes out due to the router losing it's connection to the internet which forces you to manually turn it off and on (and hope that it will reconnect) or pavlov goes down al together which mean you have to call them, wait forever on the phone for them to finally talk to you, then explain to them the problem 5 different ways (after they've asked the question "are you sure it isn't your computer that is the problem?" 10+ times), then have someone come out to fix it in the next couple days and then do it all over again in the follow days when it happens again. Other than that the Units are in decent condition though i believe we are all overpaying by about 50-75 dollars per month and the front gate is NEVER fixed. A gated community isn't a gated community without a gate. If you require at least internet a few times a week i would stay away from Creekside. I, unfortunately, am locked into a lease already..

I don't care what Cate says. I think she should take the time to open a dialogue with some of our younger people up here and give them a chance instead of judging people she doesn't know and call them names! That's mean.

text: I moved here approximately 3 weeks ago and have experienced issue after issue.  Issues are as follows:  1.  Roaches, can you believe roaches in an apartment that cost over $1,000.00 per month.  2.  Water leaking from second story apartment into my apartment twice causing me to almost fall once because I was not aware it was leaking, 3.  Jetted tubs that do not work, 4.  Gate has not worked for the past 3 weeks,  5. Commodes that did not work for almost a week.  Look carefully before moving because regardless of what happens, they will not agree to let me out of the lease.  Also not suppose to have pets, but I have seen a dog and cats often.  In my opinion, they were nice prior to my moving in, but now they only care about the money, not the tenants.

Then when they came to drop me a spare key, he was 3 hours late and when I asked him about the wifi, he simply said "it's outside our business hours right now so you can call and leave a message and we'll take care of it on Monday" I was beyond pissed that the guy was standing there in my condo and he STILL couldn't give me an answer. name: HerSOULspeaks. NSW
text: Terrible stay here . Been here throughout 2-3 management changes and no one can seem to get it right. We still have outdated appliances, management would rather argue that fix problems and somehow my account keeps getting messed up. Being, I pay my money in full  and somehow still end up with additional charges. And when I question this, instead of carefully considering things they’d rather tell you how you’re wrong. Further more, parking is terrible and they send the tow truck around on contract but fail to provide adequate parking for its actual residents. Seriously considering breaking my contract given it’s not worth it for the even outdated apartments. my floors and ceilings are squeaking daily

name: Alejandro Cano
text: Staying at the Haven is pretty average. The apartment complex workers are nice and the Hoover area is an okay area to live in. The tour was very pleasant and nice but once you sign the lease you are not treated in the same manner anymore. The apartment I was given was not clean at all, I had to clean everything before moving my stuff in. I have been out of A/C for my apartment unit for 3 weeks now and they WILL not  compensate you for anything per the lease agreement. They follow the lease agreement to the T. It is not the apartment staff fault, it is the regional manager that will reference the lease agreement constantly. I do not recommend living here because of the regional company that owns this apartment complex, they are not understanding and you will find way better apartment complexes in the area at a better price/quality.

resp.text: Alejandro, we appreciate your compliments for our team. As we discussed, the parts necessary to repair your air conditioner were delayed due to issues with the pandemic. They have been ordered and will be installed as soon as possible. In the meantime, we have supplied a portable unit. In fairness to all of our residents, we enforce the terms of the lease agreement with regard to rent concessions or credits. If we may assist you further or bring more clarity to this situation, please feel free to connect with us at thehaven@trinity-pm.com. Thank you.

name: Jordan Tippins
text: I am new to the area, and I was looking for something safe and quiet! I found the Haven, and I quickly jumped to sign a lease. Everyone in the office has been so friendly and helpful. Fredrick, the apartment manager, has been an absolute angel with helping with the move-in process. Her and Grace both have answered all 50 of my question in a quick and timely manner. I’m so happy I have found my new home at the Haven!

resp.text: Jordan, thank you so much for your 5-star review. We are grateful you selected our community to call home. Fredrick and Grace will be encouraged by your acknowledgment of their superior service.

name: Kelly Kennedy
text:
The Haven is under new management so I had to erase my previous nasty, but blatantly honest review. The new office staff is accommodating, courteous, and professional. I’ve even heard rumors that they could be painting the heinous tan, grey & baby food yellow building color palette the previous color blind “designer” selected. The interiors are actually nice; don’t let the paint spook you off like it almost did me. Hopefully it will be a thing of the past soon anyways.

I am a single woman, about 2 years away from getting a home. 2 months ago I was certain I’d have to switch apartments before that time came, but now I am confident that the Haven will be a a great place to live once more.

name: Rachel Triplett
text: I was looking for something safe and quiet for my girls and I and I stumbled upon this gem! Everyone I have come across has been friendly and neighborly. Fredrick, the apartment manager, was absolutely amazing with helping with the moving in process. She was very patient, answered my emails in a timely manner, and always let me know she was there if I needed her. I’m happy we made Haven our new home!

resp.text: Rachel, your lovely review made our day! It's delightful to know that you and your family feel so much comfort in our peaceful, friendly community. Thank you for shining a spotlight on Fredrick's outstanding help during your move-in process. It's a pleasure to have you here!

text: I have lived here since September of 2019. I absolutely love living in this area. I have felt safe since day one. My apartment is newly renovated and truly feels like home. Dawn in the leasing office is always quick to answer any questions and helped me tremendously during my lease signing process. If you want to live somewhere that is safe, pretty reasonably prices, and updated this is the place for you!

resp.text: We appreciate your review, Clementine. It has been great to have you here over the past year. We will share your positive sentiment with Dawn. Please let us know if there is anything else we may help with as time continues.

text: My husband and I moved in about a month ago now. Despite a couple of moments of noisy neighbors in the next building over, our experience thus far has been pretty cool. Frederick Mccary is one who truly cares for her customers. She was a huge help to my husband and I since day 1. I loved her honesty as well as her sweet spirit to guide us through everything. We ended up having to move from Tuscaloosa to be closer to our jobs. Though it was a tedious process  she made everything run smoothly. We are so appreciative of her and now welcomed in our new place, our "Haven."

text: Plenty of beg bugs when I stayed there before the renovation. Balconies were very dangerous as well due to the old wood that they are still using. They basically just paint over it when someone moves out. They also had plenty of  problems with their sewage, so many times the water was cut off without warning.  But the thing that did it for me were the bedbugs that hide in the corners or their carpets. Hopefully things are better.

resp.text: William, it sounds as though your experience here was not ideal. We would like to discuss your concerns in greater detail so that we may improve your time here. Your comfort is our top priority. When you have a moment, please email us at thehaven@trinity-pm.com. Thank you, and we look forward to connecting.

name: Calvin Taylor
text: Mrs.Frederick McCray has best customer services. If, you are looking for apartment home give Frederick a call.

resp.text: Thank you for the recommendation, Calvin! We agree that Frederick is an asset to our team and our community, and we will be sure to share your kind words with her.

name: Whitley Harris
text: It's been almost a year for me since I have been living there and I can honestly say I really enjoy it. Anytime I have any questions or concerns, Dawn is always there to assist me with whatever. She's always professional, she's knowledgeable of her job and very relatable. The maintenance man is amazing at his job & very expeditious about my requests, & I've NEVER waited for service. I wish the older gentleman had more assistance for such a large complex. His work alone is phenomenal I'm just saying you all should look into that.

resp.text: Whitley, we appreciate receiving your 5-star praises for excellent service provided by Dawn as well as our maintenance professional. We also made a note to evaluate our team resources in case they need expanding. Meanwhile, keep feeling right at home in your comfortable space.

name: Lee Hedrick
text:
I scheduled a tour of the complex online. I showed up 15 minutes prior to my appointment only to find the leasing office locked. The lights were on and the sign said open, but nobody was in the building. I waited until my appointment time and called the office number listed on the door and did not receive an answer.

The call was eventually routed to an off-site call center who said she would submit a ticket and get the office personnel to call me with at least an updated status of why they were not in the office. I waited onsite for another 45 minutes and no one ever returned to the office or answered my ticket. THREE days later I get a phone call from the apartment complex stating they would love to schedule another tour. They did not have an answer for why the office was closed, stated maybe it was a tour or they were walking the property. If that was the case you think they would have a record and could definitely say why they were out.

I can understand only one person working and being out on a tour that ran late, or maybe even property management issues. However, there is no reason to have the office closed for over an hour when someone had a scheduled appointment, much less wait three days to respond to them. If this is any indication of how they handle business, I would stay far away from this apartment complex.

resp.text: Mr. Hedrick, we do apologize for the experience you had at your time of visit and can assure you it is not a direct reflection of our services at The Haven. Unfortunately, there was a scheduling conflict and a previous tour ran over into your allotted tour time. We would have certainly returned your call that day, but did not receive the ticket due to a possible technical issue. We would love to reschedule your tour appointment to show you the property and inform you of our amenities and floor plans at The Haven. Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you were caused and hopefully we can alter your perception of our community with another visit. We hope to speak with you soon!  Thank you,  The Haven Apartment Homes

name: Lisa Sanders
text: No complaints. I love the area, neighborhood, and access to shops. The office team is knowledgeable and friendly. They are very swift and exceptional. They under promise & over deliver! Kudos Michael, Dawn, Grace, Bilal & Ray you all make my home life pleasant & relaxing. Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing these comments. We are happy to be of assistance.

name: Kisha Mitchell
text: We have been living here for 11 years. We have really enjoyed it. Its very safe and convenient to shops in the area.

name: frecia vega
text: The place is ok but they try to make more and more money that you don't have to take it out I lived for a year I never paid late and leave my apartment clean when I move, my surprise was that they sent me to collections and charged me $100 extra because they painted the place and had already made enough money with me to get me out more so far I haven't The people in the office are bitter, and also if you leave in a 3 level the ac is no working good I always have issues with that !

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out. We are always upfront with our residents about move-out pricing and policies, so we are sorry to see that you are disappointed. The charges you mentioned were for standard touch-up paint, steam, and clean. According to the lease, residents have 14 days to make arrangements for payment or dispute charges before they are sent to collections. We are happy to assist you with this matter at thehaven@trinity-pm.com. We look forward to speaking with you.
