name: Colton Palmer
text:
It is atypical that I write reviews, especially negative reviews. However, my experience with University Downs in Tuscaloosa has been an absolute nightmare. The experience has been so negative that it warrants more than just a bad review, but also legal action.
After the new management company (Asset Campus Housing) bought the complex from Ellis-Trick, all of the services went downhill. From trash pickup to rent payment every facet of life at UD changed for the worse. Most importantly, the management staff (not necessarily the office staff) has been unhelpful, incompetent, and downright rude.
First, even though my name was on the lease (I am looking at a copy right now), my name was NEVER put into their system, so every time I called they couldn’t speak with me (or pull up my lease apparently). Furthermore, they never put any of the emails on my lease into their system. When my roommate wrote a check for $785 instead of $795 on accident, we were never notified of the “late payment” either by phone or email – even though they had both. So they after a few months that $10 charge grew into hundreds. They then had the audacity to place an eviction notice on my door. So they can walk to my apartment to threaten eviction but they can’t notify me of a $10 dollar payment??? Needless to say I paid the $10 dollars I owed them, but not a penny more! And I wished it ended there…
When I moved to a different city over the summer (and paid two rents because I didn’t want to sublease!) they actually moved another person into my apartment!!!! I found out about this when I went back to my apartment on checkout day (to turn in my key) and there was someone else living in there with all their stuff! I have had two UD employees acknowledge this, but they don’t see a problem with it at all – even though I was still paying rent!
Finally, after months of phone calls, emails, and weeks on end of no response, I still have not received my security deposit back. They have acknowledge – finally – that they owe me the security deposit, but now they said they “mailed the check.” That was over three weeks ago. This is on the point of ridiculous. The managers at the office do not care. They are rude and completely unprofessional. I have friends who have been through similar experiences at UD! And you should understand. I took pride in my apartment. It was always clean inside and out, and well taken care of.
I could go on for another page or two…
I am going back to Tuscaloosa in a few years, and they could not PAY ME to live there.
Finally, apparently the complex is being purchased by a new company in 2016. Don’t live there!!! They are keeping the same rude and unprofessional managers – so nothing will change. In fact, it will probably get worse.

name: Janey117
text: If I could put ZERO stars I would.  My daughter moved out of University Downs last July 2016. She has been owed a refund of her security deposit in the amount of $200. We have called so many times that I have lost count, and talked to several people to try to obtain the deposit refund. The latest person I have spoken to is Vachelle,  who has promised that she will issue the check to us. I have called her four times this week, and at this point she is avoiding my calls and messages.  I guess I have no other recourse then to secure an attorney, because I have repeatedly asked for a corporate number or contact to call to have this taken care of. My daughter has lived in numerous apartments throughout her college career,  and the whole experience we had with University Downs has been the absolute worst by far.  Withholding a deposit after you have issued a letter stating that deposit will be sent is theft.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We understand your frustration and we want to help. If you have not already, please contact our Management Team at 205-752-3232 or ncook@peakcampus.com. We will try our best to work through this for you and get it wrapped up. We look forward to hearing from you and completing your request. Thanks again!

name: wilsta22
text:
Staff is awful. Maintenance would come fix some problems and ignore others. The appliances all do not work correctly. Staff/maintenance comes in whenever (literally they will knock and, from the back bedroom, not give us enough time to put pants on and go open the door before they are already letting themselves in) to fix or change things without even telling residents. They have just come in our place numerous times this year with numerous excuses. They tell you they would give residents a heads up if they have to come in, but that is not true. One day while we had multiple friends over, they came in and said they had to paint all our walls. Needless to say, that was the final straw and we told them they could not paint that day randomly without telling us, while we had people over. We live on the second story and one morning we were woken up at 8 am bc some workers had climbed up the back balconies and were on our back porch working, of course without telling us. I have never lived somewhere where maintenance just comes in without warning so many times in a year. Our friends have a joke going on about hanging at our apartment because maintenance will probably be joining us. Also, one day when they randomly came, we had an empty cat litter box. No cat, not cat toys/food, not even cat litter, just the empty box, and then they tried to charge us $500 by saying we had a pet and kept coming by randomly to catch a nonexistent cat in our place. Even then, $500 seemed like much for a cat. Another thing, along with not telling any residents about maintenance coming to do anything in residents places, they have also decided to change the internet connection and password without telling residents. We went almost a week, a school week without internet is very difficult, thinking the internet had gone out without being fixed. We finally called and they told us it had been changed. We told them we were not happy they would do that without telling us, therefore making us go without. The next day, after we had gone the week without internet and then resolved the issue, they came by and put a paper in our door telling us they changed the internet, so at least our complaining did something, even if it was a week too late.
Overall, you will not have the privacy you want in your apartment and do not count on the staff/maintenance to do great jobs. If you can get pass that, the pools and community itself is not bad, just needs better people running it.

name: Pia Ming
text: I love University Downs!

name: Rhonda Ferrell
text: There was definitely some confusion about how and where to receive our room code.  Why wouldn't you get your code from the same building you're staying in?  Makes no sense to me.  Anyway, once we arrived at #2509, the ice maker didn't work and the recliner was badly broken.  I called to report both and was guaranteed someone would come to repair the chair or at least remove it.  Neither of those things happened.  My husband fixed the ice machine himself.  There was mold in the master bath shower and the shower curtain in one of the guest rooms was moldy.  There were no comforters on any of the beds but at least they were in the closet so we put them on ourselves.  Other than those things, the unit was nice and we hosted a 20th anniversary vow renewal there. A tropical storm came through while we were there so that was unfortunate but the view and the lazy river were nice.

name: Marc McGuire
text: Great view , close to everything. Very clean and terrific staff!

name: Alyssa Young
text:
Whereas the Phoenix on the Bay II seemed promising at first, our experience there was negative. The apartment itself was nice, despite the large bloodstain upon the guest bedroom duvet cover upon arrival, which the owner later accused us of causing. . The residents of the complex did not hold back in unleashing their full "Karen", and we were falsely accused numerous times by residents of the complex for "infractions", such as not cleaning up after our dogs- which was false and not supported by any evidence (we are very conscious of the need to pick up after our pets!!) This, along with a slew of other false accusations, resulted in nightly visits from security coming to our apartment to scold my parents (who are in their mid-60s) and I as if we were school children, putting a major damper on our evenings.  Whereas the security guards themselves were generally friendly, we felt as if we were unwelcome and being “watched”. We were also accused of not having “registered” one of the dogs, again untrue as they eventually admitted.

Lastly, and this may not be as important for some people, but the Wi-Fi network that is offered to guests is not secured. For people who work remotely with sensitive data, this did not provide an accommodating environment. Hours after we left the Phoenix, I realized that my Amazon account had been hacked- I am inclined to believe that this was a result of being forced to access an unsecured network.

After our departure the owner contacted us to complain about the apartment. Her claim was that our dirty sheets were not clean enough. Yes, you read that correctly. She also complained about other minor matters that were well within the bounds of normal everyday use. Next time we will make sure to take photos on departure.

As a residence that claims to be "dog friendly" it certainly is not in our opinion a welcoming place for larger dogs (over 40 pounds). We were constantly harassed and accused of things which we could prove we were not responsible for. Thankfully we were able to get away to the beach for a couple of days and enjoy the beautiful Orange Beach scenery and weather. If you are looking for a fun, relaxing and dog-friendly environment, this is not the place for you!!

name: Gina Bradley
text: We stayed in condo 2212 this week. Everything was clean. I wondered if the beds were not completely made up and finished because there were no comforters on the beds. We found They were in the closets. There was only a thin blanket on each bed. The Full size  mattresses could stand updating. They were a little thin and not as comfortable. The knob to the dryer was broken.  I had a hard time turning it on without plyars. I found out at the end of the week that the part had been ordered. It would have been nice if they could have left some tool for me to use to turn the dryer on and to leave a note explaining they were sorry and the part had been ordered. The air conditioner began leaking all over the floor. We called and the maintenance came to fix it. Hopefully for the next guest it will remain fixed. The owners need to update the tv. We rarely could get the remote to work. I had to call maintenance and they came several hours later saying it was fixed. I still had trouble with it.  It would be cheaper for them to get a smart tv and not even use cable. I like to be able to relax with the shows I watch and I couldn’t  do that. Overall it was a good trip for us. Perfect view of the pool with a large balcony. The living room furniture could use an upgrade as well.

name: T Reid
text: We would stay here again. Small beach bay play area. Nice hot tubs. Lazy river. Close to food. Nice views of the bay.

resp.text:
T,

Thank you for the review.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us, as well as the amenities and area.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

name: jim wood
text: They need to get communication worked out about door codes from the main desk, but other than that, it’s a fantastic place.

name: Janice Fields
text: My 2 cousins and friend had the best experience at Phoenix on the Bay II. We stayed in #2111 and we loved our place, there was nothing that we didn't like about it.  Everything was great, the only issue we had was the tv's in each bedroom was not working and we called the number at the desk and we got Jerry with security. Jerry actually said that we were supposed to call the property owner/management to fix those type of issues. Even though this was not Jerry's job to fix the TV's, he said that he would be right down. Jerry took the time out of his schedule to immediately make sure that we were taken care of and he came right away and ensured all the tv's were on and hooked up properly. A big Thank you to JERRY with security from Kim, Janice, Terri and JoAnn for your support during our stay.  The experience there was great, people were very friendly all of the security team were friendly and we never met a stranger no matter where we went. We are looking forward to returning one day soon and I hope the experience is even greater!!! I will definitely be referring this place. KUDOS to Phoenix on the Bay II, the owner of the property and to Jerry

name: Christopher Macaluso
text:
We are rule following individuals and so are our family members. We had four separate instances where our kids were yelled at or our adults were verbally reprimanded for doing what amounts to trying to enjoy our time without bothering others. Perhaps rules are rules but if you don't apply them evenly you can expect unhappy people.

First instance, my daughter lept into the lazy river feet first to hear an employee scream top of her lungs that jumping was not allowed and that was her first and final warning. The second instance a family near us was scolded for playing audible music around the pool and for having snacks by their pool chairs. Third we had a family member have their bracelet break overnight and the front desk security guard jokingly wanted 80 dollars and bargained with me for 50 bucks before realizing it wasn't funny and offering a new one for 5 dollars. Final straw was when our family staying at the next door phoenix property were told to buy a wrist band or leave when visiting our property's pool. We verified this was ok ahead of booking, but we're lied to. Apparently there's a lawsuit between the two phoenix properties and guests of the two are the ones left to suffer.

This is the first and last time we stay here. Best of luck to the owners of condos here, because the experience is horrible.

Skip this place and find a location that's more welcoming and happy to have you there as a guest.

name: Mark Qualls
text: Wonderful place to stay! Been here 2x now and really enjoy it.lazy river is very nice, scenery is nice and close to anything you need! Security and staff doesn’t allow partiers to get out of hand in any way to keep it family friendly and safe in all situations. Would definitely recommend.

text: The HOA nazis were in full force and extremely rude. Security people harassed my family the entire time we were there. I will take my money elsewhere and would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

name: Morgan Turner
text: we had A TERRIBLE TIME. The HOA security guard harassed us the whole time we were there. We could not do anything and neither could our kids. We will never go back due to how rude and hateful he was.

name: M
text: Horrible experience for a vacation rental. The security guard is rude and unless your an owner, expect to be treated like just a number. Seriously, there are LOTS of vacation rentals with beach front properties (it’s brackish water it looks like a lake) go to one with better customer service and view. This place is like the wanna be Beverly Hills hotel. I’m sure if you own one, the customer service is better. If you don’t, expect to be treated like it. Every year my sister in law goes to this place. Not anymore, because of the same security guard that is rude to her EVERY year. Seriously, lots of condos out there, pick one that is thankful for your business. Notice how the owner mostly replies to the good reviews? CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EVERYTHING!

name: Brishauna Coneal
text: Family friendly, welcoming, and clean. Would highly recommend!

resp.text: We are pleased to learn that you and your family enjoyed your stay here.

name: Garrett Stone
text: Quiet, luxurious, and a great view from the balcony.

resp.text:
Garrett,

Thank you for the review.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us, as well as the amazing view from your balcony.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

name: Mark Santora
text: I came to Phoenix on the Bay 2 to have a great time and relax with my family. My experience was mixed. While I found Brett Robinson to be very inefficient and very unhelpful, I found the home owners association to be more than accommodating. I dealt with the property manager Michael Roberts and he went above and beyond to see that we had everything we needed. He runs the property with a great staff and despite the rough start, he came through with flying colors in the end. He answered my call on the weekend and made a special trip on a Saturday night to help us. Thank you Michael! We had a great stay and the property is beautiful!

name: Michelle Walker
text: I have always stayed at Phoenix on the Bay 2. I like to stay in the higher rated rooms but I am disappointed this time. Will not stay in unit 2107 again. This may only be my personal preference but every unit needs a update every now and then : appliances update to keurig coffee maker, freezer makes noise, blinds do not close in living room/ broke. The master bedroom blinds do not close all the way and no drape behind them. Most people like it dark when they sleep and don’t want others to be able to see in. The whirlpool tub...a child can fit in it but not many adults.

resp.text: Hi Michelle, thank you for your review. I am forwarding your comments to the department manager so that she may better assess the situation with unit 2107. We appreciate your feedback

name: Leslie McDade
text: Enjoyed it as always, loved the lazy river, glad I got my own float even with the kids there it was still relaxing. Our room had a great view didn't enjoy the guy next door smoking on the balcony.

resp.text: Leslie, thanks for the great review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay!! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Clay Piburn
text: Did some renovations on it

name: Bman16
text: Very nice place, friendly staff and atmosphere, the pool attendant was very helpful and friendly

resp.text: Thanks! We try to make our guest feel at home. See you next time!

name: Gary McKinney
text: Beautiful place! They definitely put a lot of effort into maintaining the grounds and keeping everything perfect!

name: Beth Abbott
text: Loved it!!  We stayed for 9 days and only went to the beach 1 day!!  We had everything we needed on site.  Lazy river, pool, waterslide, beach area with hermit crabs everywhere, fishing and crabbing off the pier.  Awesome place!

resp.text: Beth:  Thank you for sharing your wonderful vacation experience with us.  We are thrilled to read that you took advantage of all the wonderful things POB2 has to offer.  Please come back and see us again.

name: Kristy Seamons
text: This was our first and last visit to Phoenix on the Bay II. We were extremely displeased with the whole experience. We chose this Phoenix thinking it would be a step up from the first Phoenix on the Bay. We could not have been more wrong. The staff was very unfriendly. The room was dirty upon arrival. The appliances were out dated and didn't work very well. The lazy river and pool were dirty. The pool was small and there wasn't enough seating. Definitely put a damper on our vacation.

name: Trey Short
text: I own a condo here. This is a heavenly place. So luxurious and beautiful!

name: Jeremiah Weekley
text: Great view. Great location. Friendly staff that does enforce rules fairly stringently. Views are spectacular.

resp.text: Jeremiah:  We are happy to learn that you and your family enjoyed your stay here.  Please come back and see us again.

name: Chris poole
text: Zombie apocalypse stronghold. Boat owners hidden paradise.  Right in the heart of whos who in boat life. Look for me there if we were real life walking dead stars lol. Perfect view of the island.

name: Challie Sanker
text: Enjoyed stay here and happy with the property in general. Parking is a bit of an issue and the house keeping is a little lacking but other than those two things enjoyed this place.

name: Randy Sullivan
text: The rooms and property is just beautiful. Love the pool and lazy river. Upon arriving I had to BUY a parking pass for $20 ( really ). In a email I was told my room # was 180569...NOT it was 2202 which the lady at the desk couldn't help me with anything. My room didn't have nearly enough utensils to cook a whole dinner and the ones that were there needs upgrading in the worst kind of way .The master bed made so much noise it woke either me or my wife every time we rolled...the water line from the wall to the toilet started leaking on Sunday I told a maintenance man on the property and he said he would come fix it never showed up, Monday I fell getting out of the bed my floor was wet,  the leak was getting worst I told another maintenance man and he said I had to call who ever I rented the room through by this time the leak was so bad my whole room was full of water so I turned off the water and called the lady I rented the room from. I explained what had happened she tells me and I quote " let me call a plumber and I'll give him your ( my ) phone # so we can get this fixed....I said you must be kidding you better not give anybody my number I told her I turned off the water and cleaned up the whole room from the leak I'm not doing anything else. She never once asked me if I was ok from falling or said thank you for cleaning up the mess. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone.

name: Ali B
text:
During our stay at the Phoenix on the Bay 2, we were accosted by the pool cleaning lady and the president of the homeowners association because we were not allowed to sit in the pool area by a fountain and read a book before 9:00 am. The pool itself does not open until 9:00, but we were in NO way using the pool. Just simply wanting to sit by the fountain and read. The homeowners association lady, Pam, made sure to let me know that the general manager, Michael, reported to her so it didn't matter that I had called him. She then gave me a line about the chemicals that they were putting in the pool didn't need to have anyone around them....please. So on vacation, I was run out of a chair which was not hurting myself or disturbing anyone else.

As our day went on, we were completely appalled by the behavior that is allowed at the Phoenix on the Bay 2. Adults were throwing empty beer cans from the lazy river into the kiddie pool area and slinging beer everywhere, cussing, flipping off the security guard, Quinton, who was doing his best, blocking the lazy river, and handing out shots in the lazy river. Tons of children and families were there, but no respect was given to their needs at all. My child felt very uncomfortable in the environment and hated having to go to the part of the lazy river where the "drunk adults" we're congregated.

At no time did the pool cleaning lady or the homeowners association lady come to stop any of that. Other moms were having to take their children to the small indoor pool to get away from the "GD" word. We will NEVER vacation here again. If you are looking to book here because of the slide and lazy river which children should be able to use, go somewhere else. This is NOT an appropriate environment for children or relaxation. We felt like we were in the middle of Mardi Gras weekend swimming in a lazy river of urine because these adults just pull their coolers up to the side and stand in it drinking all day.

We were made to move from a chair at 8:00am where we had coffee and a book and were not disturbing anyone with loud music or language or obstructing anyone's way...but endured terrible and obscene behavior the rest of our time. Never staying here again.

name: Elizabeth Wilson
text: This place was amazing, loved everything, however lol if someone pays on the uper 1,400$ for 7 days I feel like it's over kill to then ask for 25$ to park and 11$ for a bracelet to swim in the pool. Maybe that's just me

name: Brianna Lane
text: Staying here now! LOVE IT. Wish the master bedroom was bigger other than that its great

resp.text: Thanks so much! The lazy river makes the summer heat a little more bearable!

text: The service and people are really nice and make it a fun easy vacation but this is 4 stars because the floor on the lazy river is way to tough and I have scraped the skin off of my toes and my knuckles from it

resp.text: Thanks for the 4 star review. We are pleased to hear that you had a great experience and we look forward to the future for another vacation.

Next time you visit, if there is anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable, please contact our service desk.  We sincerely want to make your stay as good as possible.

El confort

resp.text: Teresa:  Thank you for this 5 star review.  We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  Come back and see us again.

name: Greg Newton
text: Have a son that lived here while going to Auburn University. He shared with 3 other guys, 4 bedroom and 4 full bathrooms.  Very Reasonably priced for a Really Nice Place!

name: Abby Hodgens
text: The HOA is terrible here - will enforce towing and what can/can’t be on your porch so strictly but will not give you an updated list of what items are allowed, doesn’t keep the parking spaces and visitor spots well painted (and there isn’t enough), and has left the streetlight in front of our house broken for months. Each house is privately own so it really depends on who you rent from as to how nice your house is or how nosy your landlord is. Also, the power bills here are so high because of the poor insulation in these houses. Often times my bedroom will be 5 degrees cooler than the living room in the winter. Overall very glad that I’m moving out of the neighborhood.

name: Joseph Gray
text: I lived here for most of my years at Auburn and absolutely loved these houses.  I moved from one to another during a roommate change, and can safely say these houses are pretty much all identical with the exception of some luxuries they've been equipped with by the owners.  The neighborhood always felt safe and was well taken care of.  It can be a bit of a party destination sometimes, but usually nothing too rowdy.  I loved the hardwood common area, and the kitchen was plenty for college students.  I really loved having my own bathroom and shower.  Each room has its own.  No sharing. The rental price is pretty constant among these houses (again, depending on the luxuries some owners have added).

name: Patrick Bryant
text:
There probably isn't a better bang for your buck in Auburn -  $300/month covers a large room and bathroom with a washer/dryer.

Pros:
- Price. Nothing can beat this value.
- I've rented two different houses, one from a landlord and one from a realty company and both have been nothing but nice.
- Good location for parties. Large common room floor space and I've only had the cops come once.

Cons/considerations:
- No amenities. My friends and I have been using nearby apartment complexes pools for years.
- Transit cycle is about 10 minutes and the ride is 12, which is a bit above average. The stop at Auburn is also at the very back which gets annoying.
- Power bill is high - ours is usually around $280 (split four ways) - perhaps because of the high common room ceiling. Still a great deal though.
- Not furnished. Once you bring yours down or purchase some here you're set though.

name: Damon Watford
text: I've lived here for 2 years without issues in the neighborhood. Houses are big with your own bathrooms! Beautiful high ceilings. Beware of no community amenities and high electric bill.

name: Alfreda Jeffords
text: People drive recklessly in the neighborhood despite all the children living here. Houses are cheaply built yet the rent continues to go up. There is constant flooding around homes on the south side. Most homes have not only one but two of the worst energy efficient half sized water heaters.

name: Holly Macintire
text: Great place for temporary living. Clean safe neighborhood.

name: Anthony C.
text: Centralized location great neighborhood for college students.

name: eleanor brown
text: I am not giving a one rating for the condo. I am looking to purchase a condo. I made my way to this sight and I simply saw a lot of pictures of the sky instead if the condo. I get it. Theview is beautiful,  but it makes me wonder if the condo is as good as the view since the focus is not on the condo itself.

name: Shawn Galyon
text: Beautiful place and the tenants are very kind.

name: Michael Harrah
text: Amazing place to stay

name: alex heard
text: Couldn't find the service elevator while i was working

name: Jennifer van Arcken
text: Most breathtaking views of downtown Birmingham. Easy access to Interstate and downtown, UAB and St Vincent's. Condominium complex is very nice!

name: Larry Myers
text: Great place, great people, beautiful views

name: Samantha McCoy
text: Awesome establishment and staff

name: Mimi Brown
text: Terrible place. Refused to give me back my Safety deposit, and charged me like $800 for repairs. Very dishonest people.

resp.text: Good evening Mimi, I read your review and searched our records and don’t find a record of your ever having lived here at Traditions. Would you be so kind as to share your dates of residence and which unit number you leased from us?

name: The Raging Potatoes
text: it looks very interesting and the people seem nice

name: Jessie B
text:
Excellent place! Lived here for two years and left only because of roommate issues. You get a pool, fitness center, washer/dryer, water included, hardwood floors, all for such a good price! It is also about 7 minutes from campus which was a big plus. Never had any bugs besides some silverfish so you don't have to worry about roaches! Lastly, the new manager Wade is excellent at solving your problems and promptly responding to you for any inquiry you may have. I would just say try to get an apt on the top floor bc the ceilings are quite thin and you can hear people walking often.

EDIT: Be cautious of old 1 star reviews! As I said management has changed recently and is much better!

resp.text: Jesse, thank you for the kind words and wish you well!!

name: Trinity Donnellan
text: I have been looking for a place to live and came to visit Traditions because a friend of mine lives here. I was impressed by the pricing and size of the condos, but more so by the management! Wade has been absolutely incredible in accommodating and communicating with us as we prepare to move in next fall. He truly has gone above and beyond for us, and I am excited to live at Traditions because of the great service we have received so far. It has been in great condition every time we have visited, and I look forward to moving in.

resp.text: Thanks Trinity!  We are thrilled to hear about your positive experience!  We appreciate you taking the time to post a review.

name: Jennifer Wells
text:
For Renters:
The rent is usually around $950 per room. There are no elevators, so if you're physically not able to climb stairs you'll be pressed to find an available condo on the bottom floor.

For Buyers:
The condo prices are going down $10k every year. Can't afford one now? Wait until next year, it'll drop. Finding renters shouldn't be to difficult as school restarts, such as the mid to late summer. As far as the area, the condos are very quiet. Apartments and condos usually have repeat issues of noise and domestic problems, but the only thing this area has is the rare loud car. I contribute this to the high monthly HOA prices.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Jennifer! Actually our 2 bedroom flats are $950 for the entire unit($475 per room)😀. We still have some 3 bedroom flats for $1380 and a 3 bedroom townhouse for $1500( entire unit)

name: Stephanie Hall
text:
I lived at Traditions for a year. The grounds and apartments/condos are nice and well maintained. There is a good mixture of college students as well as families in the facility so the noise level is not out of control.  I liked having it gated and felt safe in the facility while walking my dog outside at night. I would definitely recommend the complex!
The train runs behind the complex, but you don't really notice it after a while so I was not bothered by it.

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Layouts of the apartment numbers are confusing, but sort of easy to see from your car

resp.text: Smitty, thank you for taking the time to rate Traditions!

name: Jamie Leeds
text: Lived here 4 years and loved it! Mostly quiet and further from campus than most apartments, but it's not a long drive at all. I never had an issue with management or the apartment I lived in. 5 STARS!

name: Kandle Osmer
text: I wish I didn't even have to do one star! WE TOOK OVER A LEASE. We lived there 6 months! When I signed the lease, it was a $555 fee I paid. I had a dog and asked the girl SEVERAL times, if she was sure about me not paying it. She said it would be fine. NOPE.. we got a bill, when we moved out. For that, replacing some blinds that were FINE when we left. For a garbage disposal that apparently wasn't working and we NEVER EVEN turned it on and tried to use. We barely were even there, besides sleeping. They charged us for light bulbs being blown out and for the tubs needing to be drained. The sinks and tubs CONSTANTLY needed draining weekly. None of this was our problem or fault. SO RIDICULOUS. I THANK GOD were out of there and have our OWN home again. I do NOT recommend this place at all. One more thing, people only worked when they felt like. No one was ever in the office.

name: Samantha Sledge
text: A beautiful community.

name: Sandra Lowrey
text: Very helpful. Information was immediately provided. Excellent service!

name: Robert Baxley
text:
I've lived here for three years. It's a really nice apartment complex and relatively cheap compared to apartments closer to downtown. Unless being 10 minutes away from everything really bothers you, the distance is not a problem at all. Tuscaloosa is just not that big to make it an issue. The management is pretty solid--as long as you're dealing with an actual manager and not one of the assistants. Pool area is really nice and peaceful. High ceilings, granite countertops, hardwood floors, and a sizeable outdoor patio. It's pretty much checks all the boxes for your "House Hunter" list. It's also one and a half minutes from two grocery stores, pharmacies, and some fast restaurants. It makes it very convenient on one of those days where you need to get dinner quickly.

The girl who complained about getting the boot on her car is right--they will boot cars usually two or three times a year. However, they only boot cars that don't have the "Traditions" parking tag. So her dumb ass probably forgot to put it on there. It happened to my roommate around six months have he moved in with me. He never put the tag on until he got booted. But you know what? That's what happens when you make a mistake like that. It sucked for him and me (I had to give him a ride), but in the end he understood. He kept his tag on from that day forward.

It's a really nice apartment complex. It doesn't get too wild, but people generally are tolerant of fun. Great balance for Tuscaloosa. I've never had a worry about my safety while I've been here. Honestly, I wish I could pick it up and move it with me.

name: emily holifield
text: Giving this place one star is simply giving it too much. If you are looking for a place to live in Tuscaloosa, do NOT live here. It has been one thing after the next ever since we moved in. To top it off, my roommate and I woke up this morning to an $80 boot immobilizing both of our vehicles. Not only did we miss work, but we also missed our classes. This is unreal. I have never witnessed such poor management. Every time I call the main office I very RARELY receive an answer and IF I do, they are always extremely unhelpful and unprofessional. For the money we pay to live here we should receive much better treatment. All in all, DO NOT live here.

name: TJ Ward
text: The people working in the office are very shady. They will charge you for things that never even happened. Upon moving out, I was charged $895 for having a pet, but I never once owned a pet while living in Tuscaloosa. When we confronted the office about this charge, Phillip, the property manager, said it was a mistake and the charges were for not moving out in time. They can't tell me what they have on record as my move out date. Please avoid this property and all of Spaces Management's properties. The company is full of sketchy people, and all they want is to get as much money out of you as they can.

name: Joshua Butler
text: The people in the office are very helpful and helped arrange something just for our needs. You get a tour of the exact apartment you could be staying in and they try to pick you one best suited to your need. The whole area is well maintained and kept very neat. Everything is very spacious and there is plenty of parking. Not to mention that laundry and water are provided so all you have to worry about besides rent is electricity and internet and tv(comcast). There is a beautiful fenced-in pool and a clubhouse and the location is only 3 minutes away from Target and the mall.

name: Savanna Clark
text: How much is one bedroom

name: kim nicholson
text: Do Not RENT HERE!! There hasn't been one positive experience at this place! My son and his roommate signed a lease for one apartment and were placed in another. The first month my son lived here the air was out for the entire month of August with temperatures in the 100's which led to a $460 electric bill, after dealing with the incompetent property manager, it got fixed, two weeks later it was out again, after several calls to the property manager again and my son and myself being talked to like we were children, it was fixed again. Homecoming weekend I went to stay the weekend with my son, visitor parking was full so I parked in his roommate's parking spot, I went out before going to bed before midnight, visitor parking was still full so I left my car in front of his apartment, only to have it towed during the night, after $150 towing fee and $70 to have my car realigned, they refused to compensate me in any way, saying I should've taken my car and parked it somewhere off site and got my son to pick me up! The towing company had no business signs anywhere, it's a house trailer that appears to be abandoned, with a chain link fence and only had the 4 cars that were towed from Traditions and a few undriveavle cars that had been there for yearsI'm wondering how much of the towing fee the property manager got! When I asked the tow guy if they were in cahoots, he just laughed and asked me, if I knew Phil!  Why would someone pay rent on an apartment and not be able to park or visit your child?? The property manager Phil is shady. Do Not Rent Here!!!

text: Nice units. Great location!

The apartment was perfect on move in day,  and all appliances, amenities,etc were exactly how she promised us it would be. Thanks Again!

name: Lexi Folsom

I love this place! The apartments definitely give you a very at home feel and so clean and such an easy move in to. Destini, went above and beyond to help me and made me feel welcomed! plus she has an amazing style, which helped me feel very connected to her as well :)
&& they are very pet friendly my little puppers has made new little friends here and I love it! I couldn't ask for a better place!
you won't regret living here !!!

name: Jamie Stone
text:
I have lived here for over a year now and I can say it’s
one of my favorite places I’ve lived. Great neighbors and just an all around good community.

name: tylesha washington
text: Thank goodness I’m out of there! It was a little too late to try to “fix” the leak. Hilarious how it got “fixed” after I turn in my termination letter (which they LIED like they never got, thankfully I recorded). I was told my leak was going to get fixed sooo many times but yet every time it rained/stormed my kitchen and back constantly had water coming in after multiple times maintenance came to caulk it. Then I’m the mist of moving water was on my table so that’s even more damage. Hopefully one day they properly fix 2079A and not just re do the floors. Maybe this fix they just did will help. I moved in October water issues happened in December, this new management came like January and here it is may and the issue is now “fixed”. Wish it would’ve rained so I could’ve seen if it actually worked or not.

name: Calix Ainslie
text: You get what you pay for. Management does what it can, but after a year-long bug infestation, several unresolved maintenance issues that have persisted since move-in despite maintenance requests, and more than one “professional” communications in all-caps, I’ve learned my lesson. Definitely won’t be staying here long-term.

name: chris kauhn
text: There very friendly and helpful, I had great customer service and that’s hard to find now a days, I loved living here real nice apartment and great prices, I felt very safe there with my family

name: Sierra Alexnder
text: They are a great apartment complex rent is kinda high but it comes with the area and Destini at the leasing office is really nice and understanding and very helpful in any way possible they respond in a timely manner and maintenance come in a timely fashion as well highly recommended

name: PrototypeX113
text:
Good service,Very kind staff and overall a Great place to stay
The property manager Destini was very kind and made everything simple and stress free

name: Melena Estaine
text: Very helpful and kind staff! Good pricing for the area as well.

name: Kimberly Daniel
text: Destini is a wonderful manager she is always understanding and makes sure she helps anyway she can .

name: Jennifer Burgett
text: Nice property & located in a great spot where you're close to everything!

name: Sky Jett
text: Great apartments. 10/10 Would stay here again

name: chante hunt
text: Great area! Close to EVERYTHING! They apartments are pretty decent. Reason I don’t recommend is because of maintenance. I’ve been her 2 whole years and my outlet for my dryer hasn’t worked! The first dryer I had went out and it wouldn’t dry my clothes. So I throw it out. Thinking it was the dryer. So I went and bought another one. Still wouldn’t dry my clothes. Then after a month it went out. So at this point I refuse to buy another dryer. So I called an appliance company and someone came out. Come to find out it’s the outlet. They guy said wasn’t enough power pulling through and needed to be replaced. My dryer worked just fine. So I tell the maintenance people about it. And only thing they was going to do was reset the breaker. Till this day, I am still not able to use my dryer. My oven went out about 2 months ago and it still hasn’t been replaced either. You don’t get any updates about your work orders or nothing. I hate it. There is nobody to talk to about the issue or nothing. That’s why when my lease is up I’m moving out. Other than that it’s pretty ok. Not 5 star though.

name: Diamond Pratt
text: I hated this apartment complex so Bad. The apartment complex was almost 1,000 for a one bedroom. They wasn’t understanding. The apartment that I was supposed to move into I never moved in it. They put me another apartment. My heat went off for a whole a month and they wouldn’t put me in a model they gave me a heater. And then they always had new management. I really hated this apartment complex. I signed a least for 650 I never payed 650 I payed 900 every month. And they will call your phone about the rent . After being there for 2 years I just let it go I hated and It was just not worth it. You guys please look at other apartments it’s not worth it

text: So far it’s been a great place to live! They do stuff for residents like Tasty Tuesday! And are super helpful with any issues!

text: The staff there is always helpful and timely with any requests.  Amber is amazing at her job and has helped me resolve several issues very quickly.  Marisa (?) has also come on board recently and is just as helpful and caring as the rest of the staff there.

text: It is very quiet here, amber and rest the office including maintenance now are awesome, takes care of any request that need to be done. I would recommend anyone to come live here. The area is a very safe area to live especially when ya have children.

text: Pretty nice area and great schools. My apartment is really nice and spacious. The office  managers Amber and Marrissa are really nice and professional . The laundry room could use some updates but overall its been a nice experience so far.

name: Reneshia Bryant

name: Sherita Smith

Both were very knowledgeable about the property and went into detail of the amenities and even a great “Preferred Employer” discount. I’m defiantly feel like this will be a great move me.

The office staff are so pleasant, no matter what small problem I have they always manage to fix it ASAP, and they are the nicest people especially Amber, I absolutely love her she has a great personality, very professional, and you can tell she loves her job. I wouldn’t want to live anywhere else.

name: Lynsey Lockard
text: Marissa and Amber really have transformed these apartments. They are enthusiastic about their job and keeping their residents happy! It is always refreshing to walk into a leasing property greeted professionally and to see friendly faces! They always resolve my issues in such a timely manner that I cannot complain! Alpine is in such a convenient location as well! I know alpine village will succeed as long as Amber and Marissa are there!

text: In search of a new apartment and Amber was OUTSTANDING! I've never went to an apartment complex with such superior customer service. The property was well maintained, looks like they have a great maintenance staff also. This property is definitely one of my top choices. Thanks Amber!

text: I checked out Alpine Village looking for a 3 bedroom and was extremely impressed with the customer service. Marissa was so friendly and helpful and made feel very important. I will definitely keep them at the top of my list.

text: Alpine Village is a great place to stay! This place is by far my best experience in apartment living. Amber is always nice and makes sure I am satisfied!

name: Aderenle Ademikan
text:
Amber is amazing. She went above and beyond all the stars in the sky. When I had a problem she fixed it above and beyond. Marissa is amazing as well. When I moved in my apartment she made sure every issue I had whether minor or major was fixed instantly. I’m so happy for choosing alpine village as a place to call home. Thanks so much. 😘😍😍
Sincerely Antoinette.

name: Anna Beahm
text: Management was very helpful to fix the problems in our apartment. Amber and Marissa were very kind and helpful. It's always great to see smiling faces at the office! Haven't had many issues with neighbors or noise. It's in a great location close to the interstate and shopping in Hoover/280 area.

name: Susie Becker
text: I was looking for my daughter and grandkids and stumbled upon Alpine Village. Marissa was so helpful, professional, and courteous! She went above and beyond to make sure my family would love the place, area, and be safe and content. You go Marissa!

text: Amber and Marissa gave me such good customer service I had to post on Google about it. If you are looking for spacious apartments for a good price in the right part of town with caring management then Alpine Village is where you need to be. I can't wait to move in! Thank you Marisa and Amber for everything!

name: Ken Rosser
text: My very first time renting and I am so relieved to have had such a great experience. I once had my dishwasher mess up and they fixed it within the hour! Marissa has been a huge help thru this whole process. Would really recommend choosing Alpine Village as your place to stay!

name: Charlessa Hoskin
text: I don’t recommend no one to move in at City Heights Hoover Apartments! If you don’t have a internet service you still have to pay 75.00 a month such a rip off, the water, sewer, and trash fees are ridiculous high and even at the end of that Amber and her boss Susan  take your deposit they try and tell you some like it is at the rear the reason they took your deposit but from the beginning they tell you you would get your deposit back but at the end of it you find out you don’t get it back!! The back of the apartments have mold and spider wells they need to pressure washer them!!! If u paying all that money surely it should be done better than what it looks like!!!!

name: Larena Erskine
text: Amber is such a sweet & warm person. We had a great experience with her!! Thanks Amber for helping us in our decision!!

name: Dominique Larriett
text: I absolutely love this place. Friendly office staff. I highly recommend Alpine if you are looking to live in the Hoover area.

text: I recently moved here into a 2 bedroom apartment. Upon move-in I had experienced a few small hiccups. I was AMAZED at how fast the management and maintenance jumped in to help me and assist me with my move. I am all about first impressions and they held a 5-Star!!  I could not have been more impressed with this team getting me settled into my new home.

2034 Alpine Village

Awful....Only on office person is friendly and that's the one that sits in the front. Other than that the one in the back is rude. I've been having problems since I moved out here and frankly I'm tired of it. I'm ready to move. At this point I care and don't care what happened. I've been fed with lies since I got out here. Some respond asap if you know of any lawyers

text: The staff is super freindly and informative about the area. They were so helpful in my new move to the city.

text: My apartment is spacious and it’s a nice area . The manager Amber is very professional and the her manager was very friendly as I moved in . I look forward to living here

name: MrHoward916
text: All of these other reviews are legitimately fake. Almost every building is infested with bugs. These apartments just went under new management (Implicity)2 months ago and nothing has been improved whatsoever. They treat the majority of their residents like garbage and Amber is the most ghetto and unhelpful one there who has been fired from other properties. Also, you dont know how much your rent truly is until the day its due. Document everything if you make the mistake of moving in.

name: Kelly James
text: I was currently looking for an apartment in the hoover area and after going to all the surrounding apartment complexes I stumbled upon Alpine Village as I was driving by. Walking in I was greeted with open arms and the environment in the office was nothing but positive and inviting. The two girls in the office were extremely helpful and patient. I believe their names were Amber and Marisa. I left the leasing office feeling better than I did leaving any other apartments that day. As I was leaving I also ran into Johnathan (I think that is his name) the maintenance supervisor and was blown away with how nice and friendly he was. It is that kind of customer service that makes looking for apartments a breeze! Although I did not end up moving in because my job had stationed me somewhere else I now look forward to moving back to Birmingham and renting from Alpine Village. Thank you for make my apartment searching experience an easy one!

name: Jas C
text: Management is horrible and maintenance will try to enter your apartment without notifying you. I have video record of them entering my apartment but the notice left on the door says they left a mailbox key in the office. There is no reason you should have to enter my place of residence to give me a mailbox key! I was stung by a bee and had to go to urgent care for it. I called and put in a request online to have the nest removed from by my front door and was told I would have to wait for them to remove it. So I’m supposed to fear being stung AGAIN until the end of the week. They could care less because it’s not at their door! BS!!!! I’d live in my car of this was the only option for living! Will not be renewing my lease.

name: Justin Chamblin
text: Awesome Staff Marrisa and Amber make finding and living in your home easy and comfortable

name: Jeffrey Harris
text: Alpine is a great place to stay, management is caring, professional, and they are always doing nice thoughtful things for their residents.

name: Bryan Austin
text: This is a great apartment in a great location and the staff is supper nice.

name: Durran Turner
text: Amber and Marissa are very professional love the new place!

name: Kay Mitchell
text:
Take your business and money elsewhere if at all possible.

I’ve only lived here for a few months and I regret it. There are hidden fees that were not explained and I was unaware of until I got my last bill. I had made numerous attempts to reach the office and was unsuccessful until I sent an email stating that I wanted someone to address the complaint I had. Finally I made contact with the Property Manager. I asked for explanation and I got some crappy excuse about the cost of my bill and told “Sorry for the hidden fees.”

I’m fine with the rent, water, trash and sewer fee. My first sewer bill was 88 dollars and I think that is unfit and unfair. I understand that there may be an inflation cost with the County or BWW but this is ridiculous. Still it’s been paid on time like everything else. The kicker for me is the “Mandatory Cable Service.” I was told that it came with my unit. I’m being charged for 1 HD cable box and 10MB of internet speed that I never even had set up. Recently, I called to get it set up and the customer service rep had a horrible attitude and said that there is a 65 dollar service connection fee due upfront BEFORE they come out to set up service. I was told that this is mandatory although this unit came with cable and internet and I’m being charged 75 dollars monthly for it. Pathetic.

I constantly have problems with my toilet, there’s mildew in the hall and bathroom and my air constantly goes in and out. I’d rather turn a fan on. DO NOT BRING YOUR BUSINESS HERE.

The staff seemed nice and friendly and that’s what will draw you in. Response time to application was swift. Which is what impressed me. But stay away. Go somewhere else. I do not intend to renew my lease. I will be leaving the first chance I get. I am strongly considering just paying to end my lease just so I can go somewhere else. If I am going to pay 850-900+ a month for an older 2 bedroom 1 bathroom unit then I expect better service. For there not to be trash everywhere and for the necessities in my unit to work properly and to know exactly what I am going to be paying for upfront.

name: Andre Weathers
text: Floor very weak, plumbing backs up , air unit still not fixed.. Called the office and maintenance said their ordering parts since last year and the floor is bouncing because it's been worked on before.. I worked in construction before .. I know what a weak floor  feel like .. very dissatisfied..!!

text: Great Managers. awesome service.

Been here 3 days and the environment is unfriendly for kids to play because teenagers hang out smoke dope and sell it in the open!!!  The appliances half work, HVAC unit is rigged and freezes up and it hasn't got hot yet!!  Closet doors are missing, it's an odor that no one can explain (mold)........ Etc.

text: They kept my deposit and the water bill is really high it was only my wife and me and we need to pay around 120$ per month I don't recommend you this place to live.

text: Mold and water leaks everywhere. Sewage backs up into the garage disposal. And the phone is always disconnected two months at a time

name: Andre' Savoie
text: Just a magnificent location on the Ole River and across from the beach. We visited during a homeowners meeting and it looked like over 100 people were there which is great to see so many owners present who care about their building.

name: Ally Whobrey
text: Perfect location... Across from the beach with a red light for crossing, on the river with docks for personal boats, a family pool as well as an adult pool, units face the river, the pool or the beach. Family friendly condo. Units are only able for rent for a month or longer.  Live in manager. Parking able for covered parking. On the east side of the pass where there are less tourists and one mile from the flora-bama. I may be biased because my family loved this place that we purchased a unit. Units sell quick so if you're looking for a condo, better act fast if you are interested in a unit. Tons and tons of entertainment, food and shops near by. The Christmas light near by are absolutely gorgeous!!

name: Glinda Mantle
text: I always enjoy my visits here! The pool area is lovely,  and the view from my girlfriend's balcony is absolutely beautiful!

name: M. Taylor
text: Beautifully maintained.  Quiet well appointed units. Great manager Alan

name: Daniel Wilson
text: Really nicely done with a pool for adults and a separate pool for families.  Immaculate property.

name: Stephanie Gray
text: Love it, come back every year

name: Kimberly Wildebrandt
text: AWESOME Place ,We Loved It 😍

name: Max Madere
text: Right on the river and right across from the beach!

name: Rik Reynaers
text:
Old building with class and style.
Some slight improvements like WiFi broadband connection throughout the complex might improve the luxury feeling.
The highway company that manages the busy chunk of highway that passes virtually below the building, might realise that they owe the inhabitants of the buildings the installation of double glass in each apartment.
The swimming pool, gym and sauna are in an urgent need of upgrade.
So, all by all a super location that can be upgraded at a minor cost, compared to the size of the building

name: Nathan Martin
text: Beautiful place!

name: hilary schulak
text: Nice place

name: Heather Johnston
text: Convenient

name: Kimberly Bivins
text: From our experience, these are older condos that could use some updates. They do have a nice view and easy access to the beach. The pool area is small, so if you have children, be prepared for them to whine that they want to go next door to the condos with the nice slide!  Lol

name: Misti Ray
text:
We had a very nice stay here! The rooms were very nicely decorated and the and the rest was as well.
Sure there are way nicer ones in the area but this on did is job very well!!!!

name: Lisa Beauboeuf
text: Great place. Very nice Condo. Well kept.

name: Jason Mccormick
text: Good location, easy access to the beach. The rooms are dated, the pool area is very small, no grills. There’s a huge green area that’s on the property, it would be nice to update the pool area to include a pavilion, grills, water slide like the one next door. .

name: Mike Italiano
text: The best 4th of july ever from the breakers in Orange beach alabama

name: Jennifer Mowery
text: Good location, parking available, safe, a small pool but warm and clean.  Our unit was on the second floor and it had everything we needed.  Out dated but that didn’t bother us.  The towels could definitely be replaces or add some more to...there was barely enough.  A little bit more of a walk to the beach but our views were amazing.

name: Susan Gill
text: Rented unit 31. Extremely well appointed. Quality linens, nice cookware and appliances. New washer dryer. This complex is SO CLOSE to the beach...not like places you have to walk through a garage or parking lot. You are right on the beach. Nice pool, amazing views of the beach from the balcony. Liquid Life property managers are the best. We had a problem with electricity not working in the master bedroom, and they immediately sent an electrician. When he couldnt fix the problem they gave me a partial refund. Very fair and very understanding. I plan on making this my regular summer beach spot!

name: Fred Crow
text: Not bad at all. First stay in a condo, so i had to get used to the differences from a hotel, but it was really nice when i did. My only complaint is that the internet only worked half the time, and the TVs were confusing, and a lot of the channels would work sometimes and not work other times. Good thing we brought our laptops.

name: rick cannici
text: We stayed here for spring break this year. The condo was a bit older but was very clean. I loved being right on the beach for the week.

name: Kylee Kubat
text: The Breakers is one of my favorite condominiums and was the FIRST condo built in Orange Beach! It is a cute, small, low-density building that makes it a quiet hideout for owners and guests and features an outdoor pool right on the Gulf. The condo's units are all 2 bedroom, 2 bath, and includes an over-sized living room [just in case you want to put on a record and dance!] The Breakers is so awesome, that Kenny Stabler had a unit here! With a nostalgic vibe and lots of memories from first-timers and long-time returners, The Breakers proves to be a favorite!

name: Matt Schlemmer
text: For the price u can't beat it, went before rates went up in the summer. Price was 135$ a night. Everything was clean and the view was nice. Would definitely recommend for families on a budget.

name: Morgan Gaither
text: Our condo was great and good beach access! Book unit 43 it’s super clean and pretty and the owner is easy to contact and work with. Unfortunately the pool atmosphere is horrible. The pool itself is super small and not enough chairs. For a place that has 32 condos in it 10 chair is not enough! People playing loud vulgar music isn’t not a relaxing and enjoyable place to be.  Also there are no public restrooms to use on the ground floor which is inconvenient.

name: Bill Cox
text: Conveniently located across the street from several restaurants and shops. Beautiful beach and town.

name: Clay Elliott
text: Even though this is one of the older condo complexes, it is still very nice! Conveniently located to where it's quick access to restaurant's and grocery stores!

name: NC
text: The view is incredible on the upper floors. You're near the beach and the town, so you'll always be near something interesting.

name: Marshall Mooney
text: I'm not very impressed with this place.  It's just old and run down.

name: Patsy Woods
text: I love this place it was very clean I found my home away from home definitely will be staying here every time I come here

name: Jim Christ
text: We stayed actually at The Breakers next door to Sleep In.  It was very nice.  Quieter than Sleep In.

name: Orange Beach Condominiums
text: The Breakers was the first condominium built in Orange Beach- and it has aged gracefully! A very nice and quiet low-density condominium that is perfect for all ages of vacationers.

name: Bo Tucker
text: If you're one of the folks that have a condo here, you're lucky. Perfect location.

name: sean jones

Grest

name: Cosmin Maxim
text: The pool and rooms are amazing! it's obvious the effort they put into the rooms and making sure you have a great stay!

resp.text: Thanks for your fantastic review of Brett/Robinson Vacations, it's providing experiences like the one you've described that keep us excited about what we're doing every day!

name: Luke LaFever
text:
Place was fine, but for some ungodly reason they have construction going on in the morning. Laying in bed after 20+ minutes of hammering from some unknown location. Called the front desk to no avail/answer, called the general Phoenix number only to be directed back to the front desk who once again didn’t answer despite having been available for an hour according to their answering machine.
This is kind of secondary/mild but whatever washing machine the staff use may be on the weaker side as there are mystery stains on some sheets and towels. Had some staff come in to replace some so it wasn’t too big an issue.
Leaving this review since hammering in the morning is unacceptable and no one is answering.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review of Brett/Robinson. Reviews like these help us to adjust, and work hard to improve guests' experience. In these unprecedented times we are working in overdrive to uphold the Brett/Robinson standards. Thanks again, and be well!

name: Andy Boyles
text:
We visited this place in September and we were very happy with our overall experience. We stayed on the 11th floor and the views were excellent. The place is very clean, amenities and facility are new and accommodating. The lazy river was enjoyable, indoor poor/hot tubs, and private beach.

The beach views were outstanding, and the beach areas felt clean and safe.

The location is extremely convenient to Walmart and other necessities, dining, liquor, fuel, etc. Plus there’s a private parking garage.

resp.text:
Andy,

We are very pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us, as well as the local area.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

name: Bethany
text: Recently stayed at the Phoenix for a long weekend. We had such a great time. The view from the 18th floor was amazing. Purple flags were out on the beach so we spent most of our time in the pool. There's a lazy river with a water slide attached. The condo provided inner tubes. If you need a break from the sun, there's also an indoor pool and 2 large hot tubs. There was plenty of parking in the parking garage. Can't wait to visit again!

resp.text: Thanks Bethany! We try to make our guest feel at home. See you next time!

name: Paiton Young
text: This place is beautiful.  I love the property and amenities.  The only reason it isn't 5 stars is because there is no outdoor pool. They have an indoor pool, 2 hot tub, a lazy river, a tennis court ( on the 10th floor) and a gym. Of course it's right on the beach as well. I stayed 5 days with my family and we had an absolute blast. 4 stars for Phoenix Orange Beach and I'm happy to review it!

resp.text:
Paiton,

Thank you for the review.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us, despite there being no outdoor pool.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

name: Lindsey Johnson
text: I wish I could have rated a 3 1/2. This unit is definitely nit a 3 but 4 would be stretching it. We had an amazing vacation and made many memories. The condo was beautifully decorated and there was plenty of space for our family. The kitchen had some deficiencies.  There were no oven mitts and the coffee pot leaked every time we used it. Also upon check in, which is 5Pm and after hours, we learned that we had to check in at another location once. But my biggest complaint was the cleanliness of the condo. We found long dark hair in 2 out of 3 bathrooms when we arrived. Also the standing shower had dark build up around the drain and shower door. After sitting on the couch, our shorts were covered with hair. One of the most important things to me is cleanliness; especially in our world in which we live now. I want to feel like my family is safe and protected!

resp.text: Lindsey, Please allow us to look into this situation. Would you mind providing us with your contact and reservation information? Please email info@brett-robinson.com and provide: First and last name, condo building, and unit you stayed in during your trip. We hope to hear from you soon.

name: Paul Rivas
text: Was very happy with our experience! The condos were clean and had easy access to the beach and plenty of shops to visit on the strip! Another thing I was happy to see was they had a good work out room! Had enough equipment to work upper and lower body.

resp.text: Thanks for your fantastic review of Brett/Robinson Vacations, it's providing experiences like the one you've described that keep us excited about what we're doing every day!

resp.text:

Thank you for the review.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us.  Please e-mail us at: info@brett-robinson.com with any issues you would like us to know about and they will get sent to the appropriate person.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

text: Have been coming down to orange beach since I was born, and this resort is one of my all time favorites

resp.text: We so love to hear this Riley. The Gulf Coast is a place filled with special memories, and Phoenix Orange Beach is no exception. We hope to welcome you back soon!!

name: Ethan Ruelle
text: Best condos on the beach. Amazing beach access and beautiful spot.

Ethan,

Thank you for the review.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us, as well as the amazing beach.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

Brett-Robinson Vacation Rentals

name: Tammy Chandler
text: We usually stay at pheonix west 2 at least 2 times a year. Decided to try it here this time!!! We absolutely love it!!! Will definately be staying here again!!!

text: 1st day impressions are great, easy check in, great condo, pool beach lazy river close together.  We are on 7th floor so great in out to parking to room.  They need to label parking lot levels but don't think they are done with the building yet.  Had issue with freezer but maint. got to it and fixed quickly.

name: Brian Jett
text: We have been here 2 times.  Unfortunately no tennis here until they get the courts fixed.  Great location away from the crowds.

name: Cody Loveland
text: Beautiful location, beach access and clean pool. Kid friendly with plenty of nearby food options

name: Ron Mason
text: Loved it. Room 216A is a one bed, perfect for two.

name: CaleHeintz
text: This is where we stayed for a few days while visiting on vacation. Very clean and nice facilities. Great people. Loved that they have an outdoor hot tub and nice pool.

name: Anne Bet
text: Cozy rental condos by the beach! We stayed in a two bedroom condo, which was about 600sqft. It came equipped with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and seated balcony. The location is perfect for beach access and local restaurants and bars. With covid restrictions, it was easiest to drive (about 20min) to Florida for night life. Most bars there are open until 1 or 230am, whereas Alabama now has to close at 11pm.

name: Sam Hall
text: It's a quiet and well run. We stayed for a week with no troubles, quiet neighbors, and a beautiful view. Getting to the beach is easy enough as well.

name: Genevieve Muniz
text: We love this place! Stayed here for 3 months. Beautiful and quiet

name: Chamaine Ray
text: Great location.  Away from the crowd but not far from the main attractions and restaurants

name: Rick Bartel
text: Great location for beach access and far enough away from the crowds.

name: Kim Roy
text: Love this place! Been going here since 2007. Not a party place but more of a family relaxing place, which I Love.

name: Grant Ball
text: This an amazing plase to stay the tennis courts are nice

name: #str8royalty
text: Very beautiful surroundings, Not updated.. room given was horribly laid out.. Not maintained.. living room needed deep cleaned.

name: William Hardy
text:
My cousin bought a condo there
This was our first visit.  WOW.
The view is awesome. On one side you have the bay and the other side is the ocean.  We will be back.

name: james calvert
text: Awesome condo building on West beach

name: Nick Monroe
text: Enjoyed our stay here! Stayed in 616a and let me tell ya, perfect spot. It's at the very end of the main building, so 2 balconies. 1 beach view and 1 lagoon view. Noone running passed the room all hours of the night. It's a tad small for our family of 4 but we made it work. Great location as well, far enough away from the main stretch so it's not real busy, but close enough to get to. And the beach access right across the street is super nice. Good pool area too, gets a little crowded but what pool doesn't ya know? Recommend staying here. Price wasnt too bad either.

name: the grinch
text: Best play

name: Sebastian Buisson
text: I really enjoyed my stay here. It was close enough to all of the local hotspots and walking distance to a beach. The condo itself was beautifully decorated and cozy.

name: Sean Clouatre
text: Condo was a lil small but facility was awesome

name: patty p (Patty P)
text: We stayed here 2 years ago and had a good time. Here we are again, and we won’t be back. Room 506A hasn’t been updated since 1980 it would seem. Half the light bulbs were out, bed was unbelievably uncomfortable, couch was a joke, no batteries in tv remotes. There was no comforter for the bed. Then after day 2 we smelled something bad in the washer, it was a wet soggy smelly comforter. Just spend a little more and rent a beach house.

resp.text: I am so sorry that your condo was not in satisfactory condition. Please note the HOA has nothing to do with individual condos here as we do not rent condos through the HOA. Each condo is individually owned and either managed by the owner or a management company. Any complaints should be forwarded to the management company or to the owner.

name: Clay Mcintyre
text: Been coming here every year since 2007.  This year (2018) the prices have sky rocketed.  It costs us just as much to stay 3 days as it used to cost to stay 5 last year. They have changed to rates. I enjoy this place but this might be the last year we come because of raised rates. Used to get discounts..not sure what happened.

name: David Anthony
text:
Beware some units are not well maintained.  Avoid 304A.  Kaiser Realty does not make sure properties are maintained then just blames HOA.

First off the beds and pillows are terrible.

Bedding was not included for the futon.

The towels were not clean when we arrived.  However, simply washing them revealed the stains could be easily cleaned after washing.  This concerns me as to if the towels were never even cleaned before we arrived.

The kitchen garbage disposal smoked when turned on.

The refrigerator had grease stains on the front.

The kitchen fluorescent lights took 10 minutes to turn on.

The screen in the screen door was torn. But, that really didn't matter because the screen door wheels were missing on the bottom, so the door wouldn't go in the tracks. I told Kaiser about this on the first day, but they never bothered to fix the problem.

One mirror had masking tape over a sharp edge.  That's right masking tape.

Cabinetry was cheap and dingy.

Painting done terribly with a lot of splatter.

resp.text:
I am so sorry that your condo was not in satisfactory condition. Please note the HOA has nothing to do with individual condos here as we do not rent condos through the HOA. Each condo is individually owned and either managed by the owner or a management company.  Any complaints should be forwarded to the management company or to the owner located on the condo rental page.

If you have any complaints as to the condition of the complex please respond to our email and we will address your issues.

Again I am very sorry your stay here was unsatisfactory due to the individual condo you had rented.  We take all complaints seriously and will address any complaints as to the complex to the President of the HOA.

name: Lorene Moore
text: Been twice, both condos were very nice and well equipped. Pool area is great. Beach directly across the street. Fantastic prices and very nice people throughout Gulf Shores. What's not to love?

name: April Rinaldi
text: Go to condo for years. However we went in September and landscape workers were doing yearly trimming especially on the trees and the sawdust landed in the pool our last two days and couldn't swim at all. Very disappointing.

name: Tori Sanford
text: Pretty nice place. We were here during tropical storm Cindy and it was nice to have a room with a kitchen since we ended up spending more time in our room then we would have liked. You do have to pay a 20 dollar parking fee when you get there otherwise you get towed. Nice to ha e beach access right across the street. The trash chute is in the hallway with the elevators and it stinks. We would stray here again, nice for the price.

name: Keshia Harris
text: The property & location is great! Just be care in choosing a condo. They are owned by different people & companies.

name: Shane Marcum
text: Clean and friendly service. Definitely recommend this as a olace to stay. We booked through gulf shores rentals and we recommend them as well.

name: Brenda Wernle
text: I can't say enough good things about this place! The view is fantastic! Rhonda was great to work with. Overall, I highly recommend this penthouse! We will come back and stay here. You have to see this view to appreciate it❤❤❤

name: Karry Felty
text: Quite outdated, but good for a budget friendly family getaway.  Great location with easy access to the beach and right on the bay.

name: Doug T
text: I stay here often, and it's like a second home. I love it! Great facilities, friendly and helpful staff, and wonderful views.

name: rodolfo s
text: Affordable prices, A fantastic pool. And nice views of the bay.

name: Tommy Mckee
text: Chill

name: Sherry Jones
text: Close to beach, nice room, good price

name: Christal Norred
text: Amazing place to vacation. Wouldn't chose another condo in gulf shores.

name: Jacob B.
text: The rooms fit the price. Several small things wrong with our room but nothing of a dealbreaker. They do have deeded beach access so being across the road from the beach isn't bad at all. I like that the condo is farther from the "main drag". There's less traffic and seems to be quieter and more suitable for small children and families.

name: Leanne Ferryman
text: this is my first vacation ever and i’m here for the hangout fest. we arrived at 2 pm and they would NOT let us check in until 6:30. already irritated, we finally arrive. but wait. they gave us the wrong room key on purpose! so that was an extra 30 min wait. they kept messing things up and we had to drive back and forth four times. and then we get our temporary parking pass and we tried to pay the $20 three times but there is NEVER anyone in the office. honestly i’m fed up with this place by this point. the reason i’m finally posting is because there is a creepy security guard that walks with a cane. well he kept staring at us for a good 15 min and finally walked right under our balcony and stood there and listened to our conversation for ten minutes. he walked out and said we couldn’t play music past 11pm which is ridiculous because my music was very low. this is just an awful place to stay and would not recommend to anyone. this condo does not even deserve the one star after all the hell they've put us through.  ٩(•̤̀ᵕ•̤́๑)ᵒᵏᵎᵎᵎᵎ

resp.text: I am sorry for all your issues but I need to clarify, our complex does not rent condos. If you rented through a rental companies those complaints about the time it took to gain access to your condo should be directed to them.  Complaints about the security guard will be forwarded to the President to address with the security service.  They do enforce the rules of the complex and anything heard outside the condos must be stopped by 11pm.

name: James Stewart
text: Great location, perfect beaches
